question: What is the name of the country located in the Eastern Caribbean Sea located about halfway between the French islands of Guadeloupe (to the north) and Martinique (to the south)?
explanation: Dominica, officially the Commonwealth of Dominica, is an island country located in the Caribbean Sea. It is a part of the Windward Islands of the Lesser Antilles Archipelago. In the Eastern Caribbean Sea, the island country of Dominica is located about halfway between the French islands of Guadeloupe (to the north) and Martinique (to the south). The capital of Dominica is Roseau.
